diagnoses.name: Atrial Septal Defect (ASD)

signs_any: Systolic ejection murmur at LUSB (↑ flow across pulmonic valve)

initial_tests: Echo with bubble study (diagnosis, shunt size/direction)
TEE for small or sinus venosus ASD

indications_for_closure: ASD with RA/RV enlargement or significant shunt (Qp:Qs >1.5)
closure_options: Percutaneous device closure if suitable anatomy
Surgical closure if not suitable for device

follow_up: Monitor for AF, RV dysfunction, pulmonary HTN in adulthood

instructions: Endocarditis prophylaxis not routinely indicated except 6 mo post-device closure
Report new palpitations, syncope, or dyspnea
follow_up: Cardiology follow-up, lifelong in some cases

diagnoses.name: Ventricular Septal Defect (VSD)

symptoms_any: Large VSD: HF symptoms in infancy (tachypnea, poor feeding, FTT)
signs_any: Large VSD: signs of CHF, pulmonary HTN

initial_tests: Echo (defect location, size, shunt magnitude, chamber enlargement)

moderate_large_vsd: Medical management of CHF (diuretics, ACEi, calories)
Surgical closure if persistent large shunt with CHF, growth failure, pulmonary HTN

follow_up: Monitor for endocarditis, arrhythmias, aortic regurgitation

instructions: Endocarditis prophylaxis only if residual defect at site of patch/device
Report worsening dyspnea, poor growth (peds), new murmur

diagnoses.name: Patent Ductus Arteriosus (PDA)

symptoms_any: Large PDA: HF, poor growth, frequent respiratory infections

initial_tests: CXR (↑ pulmonary vascularity, cardiomegaly if large)

pharmacologic: Indomethacin/ibuprofen to close PDA in preterm neonates

follow_up: Monitor for pulmonary HTN if untreated large PDA

instructions: Endocarditis prophylaxis for 6 mo after closure

diagnoses.name: Tetralogy of Fallot (TOF)

signs_any: Squatting behavior in children (↑ SVR reduces shunt)

initial_tests: Echo (VSD, RVOT obstruction, overriding aorta, RVH)

acute_tet_spell: Oxygen, knee-chest position, morphine, β-blocker (propranolol), IV fluids
definitive: Surgical repair in infancy (VSD closure + relieve RVOT obstruction)

follow_up: Monitor for residual RVOT obstruction, pulmonary regurgitation, arrhythmias, RV dysfunction

instructions: Endocarditis prophylaxis if prosthetic material used
